issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue is undergoing QA.  See linked QA issue(s) for progress.
status.name: In QA

fields.description:
Re:  http://emis.eucalyptus.com
 
 
The doc links, tools and configs are outdated - referencing v4.2.2
* update the old v4.2.2 doc urls to use https://docs.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus/latest/
* update any other outdated information


See EUCA-11670 - related ticket for previous iteration of this web page
fields.summary: Update emis.eucalyptus.com to reflect latest tools, configs and doc urls

comments.body:
Grabbed the page and related assets from the emis.eucalyptus.com page and set it up in this S3 bucket/webpage:

http://eucalyptus-emis.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/

The table is automatically generated on-the-fly using jQuery-table from the latest local copy of [catalog-web|https://github.com/shaon/scripts/blob/master/catalog-web] -- since this was updated a couple months back, I pulled down a local copy.

Made a minor correction to a command typo, fixed the outdated links, and just made sure it looked generally healthy.

[~mdshaonimran], [~mbacchi], let me know if the above appears to pass muster, or any suggested changes/corrections.

[~jcarroll]

Please make the following changes (The HP references need to be removed ASAP)

# Change all references of "HP Helion Eucalyptus" to "Eucalyptus" (title tag and first sentence)
# Change the copyright to "© Copyright 2017 Ent. Services Development Corporation LP."
# When the web page is ready, please ask [~kwade] to point emis.eucalyptus.com over to the new url (or if we can still use emis.eucalyptus.com on this new web site)

Thanks!

I've made those changes on my local copy, but for whatever reason, the bucket (and the webpage) are gone.

Edit: Not sure how I lost the breadcrumbs, but it's there now.

[~khadges] please verify contents. Once verified, I'll take up the discussion with @kyle regarding setting up a CNAME record.

[~jcarroll]  One change (my error)

# remove the period at the end of the copyright - it should read "© Copyright 2017 Ent. Services Development Corporation LP"

Everything else looks good. Thanks!

[~jcarroll] 

Please use the attached html file. All of the css that pointed to missing files is ripped out and I added some basic css for typography. 

Note - I removed the period at the end of the copyright, so no need to do that from previous comment.

 [^emi-index-css-updated.html]

I suppose we should also update the Centos version we suggest (now we require Centos 7 not 6.6).  

And there is a reference to "source your credentials" which is outdated as well, though in fact I would argue you wouldn't source credentials first before running the faststart script anyway, you wouldn't have credentials before faststart ran...so maybe we should remove that line, or just think about re-writing all these instructions for newer versions of Euca/faststart.

Sorry [~jcarroll] I didn't look at your updated page before making my comment above.  I'd be surprised if the 'xz' package wasn't already installed with the core Centos 7.x image, but we can leave that command there for now its not going to hurt anybody.

qemu-img is probably not going to be installed by default either, although I'm looking at the output of 'yum info qemu-img' and it shows its in the 'updates' repo so maybe it is part of the core, that's surprising to me.

[~jcarroll]

Updated table css so the header row is visible. This should do it.

Please use this html file that has table css updates - the html was just downloaded from your AWS site and updated so it should include any changes you may have made.

 [^emi-index-css-updated-v2.html]

Latest has been installed. Not seeing column headers. Correction: If you hit refresh a few times, you'll see them flash briefly.

Also, if you change the "Show entries" pulldown to "All", the result is an empty table with "Showing 1 to NaN of 14 entries".

Edit: Updated jQuery and DataTables. Looking _much_ better, now.

Is there a requirement to include the DXC logo at the top of the page?

[~jcarroll] we have not yet received the DXC web style guidelines. 

We are preparing for rebrand of docs and when we have the requirements sorted, we will make another pass on this page. Thanks for asking!

[~khadges], thanks for clarifying.

Other than that, the site looks good to go?

Got the new DXC.technology logo installed. Adjusted the width per side discussion with [~khadges],

Verified with [~khadges] that we're good to go.

[~kwade], would you be able to make the necessary DNS change to have:

emis.eucalyptus.com

point to:

eucalyptus-emis.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com

DNS has been updated. TTL is 30m so you should see the change propagating out shortly.

DNS CNAME 'emis.eucalyptus.com' now points to target 'eucalyptus-emis.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com'

Needed to make a change behind the scenes to get this working correctly.

First, created this bucket:

emis.eucalyptus.com.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com

Second, asked Kyle to change the CNAME record for emis.eucalyptus.com accordingly.

I've verified I can access the new content here: http://emis.eucalyptus.com/

[~khadges], let me know if you can confirm seeing the new content at this URL.
